intro: Hemionitis × iberica, commonly known as the Iberian hemionitis, is a rare hybrid plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Hemionitidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming structure with fleshy, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
